conclusion: The internal resistance of the silicon photocell can be determined by finding the point where the two lines intersect.
The intersection point of lines a and b represents the open-circuit voltage (Voc) and the short-circuit current (Isc) of the photocell.
From the graph, the Voc is approximately 3.6V.
From the graph, the Isc is approximately 0.3A.
The internal resistance (r) can be calculated using the formula r = Voc / Isc.
Therefore, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 3.6V / 0.3A = 12 ohms.
